intro: Koanophyllon villosum subsp. lindenianum, commonly known as the hairyleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, with a distinctive appearance that aids in its identification. The species produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by seed heads that disperse easily by wind.
